quest.name: On Low Tide
journal: His stomach behaving once more, Thancred is ready to get to work.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Be thou assured that I am quite recovered. Lassi is truly a boon for unruly stomachs.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Is it truly so amusing to see my hair bound? 'Tis how I used to wear it. A functional fashion.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Perhaps you were confused by how you found me following Nidhogg's demise. It had fallen loose after the chirurgeons removed me from my armor and put me to bed. I simply decided to leave it that way for a time, seeing as I would not don the Azure Dragoon's helm again.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Right, let us split up and make inquiries in town. Forename, the pier is yours.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Once we have learned what we can, we regroup by the aetheryte...off-putting though the mere sight of it may be.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The crate is laden with fruits, but they are on the verge of spoiling, as if they have been left too long.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Gazing out from the pier, you spy boats moored off nearby isles, with the silhouettes of larger seafaring vessels farther away.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Compared to other ports you have visited in the past, there appears to be very little activity.

dialogue.name: QEFIRAZ
dialogue.text: Well now, if it isn't a traveler... You're a rare sight in these unsettled times.

dialogue.name: QEFIRAZ
dialogue.text: People have been giving us a wide berth since that accursed tower suddenly appeared on Narunnair.

dialogue.name: QEFIRAZ
dialogue.text: If it just stood there and loomed ominously, perhaps things would be fine after a fashion, but no─it had to spawn fell fiends as well.

dialogue.name: QEFIRAZ
dialogue.text: We still have our lives thanks to the Radiant Host, but business is as good as dead. What'll become of us, only the gods know...

dialogue.name: QEFIRAZ
dialogue.text: It's a shame not everyone's as brave as you. Or foolish.

dialogue.name: DJINALEEL
dialogue.text: What am I doing? Oh, recording my sales. Still do it daily out of habit, though I don't know why I bother. Hardly sell anything these days.

dialogue.name: DJINALEEL
dialogue.text: Business has never been this terrible...but I suppose things could be even worse. I could have a consortium to keep afloat, like Khalzahl.

dialogue.name: DJINALEEL
dialogue.text: I don't envy his position. Better to be alone with my little operation, I've come to realize.

dialogue.name: DJINALEEL
dialogue.text: You're a traveler, by the looks of you? If you have a moment, perhaps you could pay Khalzahl a visit. He'd be glad for tidings from abroad.

dialogue.name: DJINALEEL
dialogue.text: Like as not, you'll find him at the Saltwind's Sails, the harbor guild building across the water from here.

dialogue.name: DJINALEEL
dialogue.text: If times are tough for me, they must be a thousand times worse for Khalzahl. I can't help but worry for him.

dialogue.name: PORTMANAGER04368
dialogue.text: And what do you expect me to do?

dialogue.name: KHALZAHL
dialogue.text: The Dalmascans aren't coming!? But we already have everything they ordered! What are we supposed to do with it?

dialogue.name: PORTMANAGER04368
dialogue.text: I don't know, but yelling at me isn't going to help. All I know is that their plans have changed, and that's that.

dialogue.name: PORTMANAGER04368
dialogue.text: Look, you must have known this might happen. The Empire is at war with itself, and the provinces are in chaos.

dialogue.name: PORTMANAGER04368
dialogue.text: And then there's the tower sitting on our doorstep spitting out monstrosities.

dialogue.name: PORTMANAGER04368
dialogue.text: The city has its defenses, but we've been afforded no protection out here. We can't blame foreigners for not wanting to take the risk.

dialogue.name: KHALZAHL
dialogue.text: Gah! But this will be an enormous loss!

dialogue.name: KHALZAHL
dialogue.text: All right, all right... Forget about the Dalmascans. Surely some ships are still coming?

dialogue.name: KHALZAHL
dialogue.text: We have fresh produce, handicrafts, medicines─all the perennial Hannish favorites.

dialogue.name: KHALZAHL
dialogue.text: Our consortium works closely with merchants and artisans to supply only the finest wares. Quality is guaranteed!

dialogue.name: PORTMANAGER04368
dialogue.text: <sigh> I know all these things, Khalzahl, I do.

dialogue.name: PORTMANAGER04368
dialogue.text: Which is why I regret to say I have nothing for you. All voyages have been canceled or indefinitely postponed.

dialogue.name: PORTMANAGER04368
dialogue.text: And you are...?

dialogue.name: KHALZAHL
dialogue.text: Wait, you're a foreigner, are you not? A merchant!? Please tell me you're a merchant!

dialogue.name: KHALZAHL
dialogue.text: I see... That's a shame...

dialogue.name: KHALZAHL
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, but we're discussing important matters. If you need something, please talk to one of the others.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Um, excuse me...

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: M-My name is Matsya, and I'm here to see Khalzahl...

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: Oh, it seems he's busy. I'll come back later, then...

dialogue.name: KHALZAHL
dialogue.text: If foreign vessels won't come to us, why not use our own to deliver the wares to them!?

dialogue.name: PORTMANAGER04368
dialogue.text: It's not so simple, Khalzahl. And besides, everyone is in the same boat. Everyone.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: Y-Yes? Can I help you...?

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: Ah, I remember seeing you back in the guild. You wanted to speak with Khalzahl, too, did you?

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: I'm Matsya, a fisherman of Akyaali─a nearby village.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: I sell my catch to Khalzahl, who offers it to foreign merchants. But he hasn't bought anything for a while now.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: When I heard that the consortium had been struggling, I became worried and decided to come and see him.

dialogue.name: MATSYA
dialogue.text: ...Just as soon as he's free, anyway. He's a hardworking man, and I dare not disturb him.
